subject: Data
title: Sample Size: When Is Enough Enough?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sample Size: When Is Enough Enough?.

hook.text: '9 out of 10 dentists recommend this toothpaste.' How many dentists did they actually ask? Maybe 10.

buildup.text: Small samples produce unreliable results. A study of 20 people can't represent millions.

discovery.text: Statistical power increases with sample size â€” larger studies detect real effects more reliably.

twist.text: But bigger isn't always better. A biased sample of a million people is worse than a random sample of 1,000.

climax.text: Checking sample size is the fastest way to assess whether a claim deserves your attention.

quiz.question: What's more important than sample size alone?
options: Whether the sample is representative and unbiased
